docstr: `RSHIFT` â€” Right shift bits ### Description `RSHIFT` returns a value corresponding to `I` with all of the bits shifted right by `SHIFT` places. If the absolute value of `SHIFT` is greater than `BIT_SIZE(I)`, the value is undefined. Bits shifted out from the right end are lost. The fill is arithmetic: the bits shifted in from the left end are equal to the leftmost bit, which in two's complement representation is the sign bit. This function has been superseded by the `SHIFTA` intrinsic, which is standard in Fortran 2008 and later. ### Syntax `RESULT = RSHIFT(I, SHIFT)` ### Arguments . | `SHIFT` | The type shall be `INTEGER`. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER` and of the same kind as `I`. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Elemental function ### See also ISHFT, ISHFTC, LSHIFT, SHIFTA, SHIFTR, SHIFTL
